intro: Morgania strigosa, commonly known as the hairy morgania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia, particularly in China and Korea. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow, hairy, and arranged in whorls around the stem. Morgania strigosa thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
